DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the urinary bladder cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the clinical M stage of a bladder tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/9/17 tt transferred context/BC; added Reg Status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Bladder Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of bladder cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of bladder cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
